FOUND IN: Cutlet - A small piece or portion of breaded and fried chicken, often served as an appetizer.
Arsenal - A large collection or stockpile of weapons and ammunition.
Entrench - To establish a position deeply and securely, usually in a military context.
Amble - To move at an unhurried pace, especially when walking or moving leisurely.
Coopers - skilled craftsmen who create barrels, casks and other similar items from wood.
Whimsy - Reflecting a playful or fanciful quality often found in Roald Dahl's stories.
Thomas Arne - Credited with the original 1739 song "Rule, Britannia!" which was later set to music by several composers including Aaron Copland and Sir Henry Wood.
Affidavit: A written statement confirmed by oath or affirmation, for use as evidence in court.
Athena - Goddess of wisdom, courage and strategic warfare.
Gunnery - The art and practice of using guns or cannons effectively.
